column4:
On the Validity of Perturbative Evolution of Structure Functions from
  Low $Q^2$
column11:
The validity of using QCD perturbation theory to generate dynamically the
parton distribution functions of hadrons, starting from a valencelike input at
low $Q^2$, is discussed. In particular, we consider the prescription of Barone
{\em et al} who evolve from $Q^2 = 0$, and that of Gl\"uck {\em et al} who
start evolution from $Q^2 \simeq (2\Lambda_{QCD})^2$.

column4: Measuring the Wess-Zumino Anomaly in Tau Decays
column5:
16 pages (latex) 14 figures (post-script) available upon request,
  TTP92-33
column11:
We propose to measure the Wess-Zumino anomaly contribution by considering
angular distributions in the decays $\tau\to\nu_\tau \eta\pi^{-}\pi^{0}$,
$\tau\to\nu_\tau K^- \pi^{-} K^+ $ and $\tau\to\nu_\tau K^- \pi^- \pi^+$.
Radial excitations of the $K^*$, which cannot be seen in $e^++e^-$, should be
observed in the $ K^- \pi^+ \pi^-$ decay channel.

It is shown that the previously known $N=3$ and $N=4$ superconformal algebras
can be contracted consistently by singular scaling of some of the generators.
For the later case, by a contraction which depends on the central term, we
obtain a new $N=4$ superconformal algebra which contains an $SU(2)\times
{U(1)}^4$ Kac-Moody subalgebra and has nonzero central extension.

column4: Theorems for a Price: Tomorrow's Semi-Rigorous Mathematical Culture
column6: Notices of the Amer. Math. Soc. 40(1993), 978-981
column11:
The future of mathematics is described, by using the WZ algorithmic proof
theory as a parable.
